Builders of Khajuraho

The Chandela rulers of Jejakabhukti (Bundelkhand), originally feudatories of the Pratiharas, became a sovereign power in the 10th century. They are world-renowned for their unique architecture and patronage of the arts. They constructed magnificent temples in their capital Khajuraho, which are excellent examples of Nagara style architecture and are UNESCO World Heritage sites.

тЪФя╕П
Military Achievements

Vidyadhara was one of the most powerful rulers of this dynasty. He is considered the only Indian ruler who successfully resisted the invasions of Mahmud Ghazni. The Chandelas also had continuous conflicts with the Kalachuris and Paramaras. Rulers like Yashovarman and Dhangadeva expanded the empire and made it a major power in North India.

ЁЯУЙ
Decline

By the end of the 12th century, invasions by Prithviraj Chauhan and later by Qutb-ud-din Aibak weakened the Chandela power. By the early 13th century, their influence was limited to local forts like Kalinjar and Mahoba.
